quotes.quote: I've had to spend an awful lot of my life trying to pretend I'm not posh. Although once I open my mouth, I rather let things out the bag.
I'm not actually posh; I'm really rough and from the wrong side of the tracks. I grew up in Putney, which is pretty rough.
I worry I look posh and fat. I can't do anything about posh - I'm accentless - but I've spent 20 years battling my weight.
No matter how irrelevant social class now is, even the most eager egalitarian must be quietly proud that the posh English rose is still an industry standard for peerlessly sophisticated beauty.
Posh people blow my mind. Apart from empathy, they're good at everything - true survivalists.

I don't live a very posh life. There are no drivers waiting or people doing everything for me. I pretty much live like a normal person... It's not good to have a life without responsibilities, you know?
If someone thinks I'm posh, it just shows how lowly they are. Some people think I went to Eton. I'm far too stupid to get into Eton.
Posh does not equal style. Really, God, that's just ridiculous. Posh equals tradition. Anyone can achieve style. It doesn't matter who you are or where you're from.
They were so posh that even their Dutch sounded French.
All true, of course. I can’t deny my posh accent or my privileged background. But there are things they don’t know about me, too. Things long-buried and forgotten about.
I understand that people want to see just the posh side of fashion, but fashion is a lot of work.

I don't like posh hotels. I like small, eclectic hotels, and luxury for me would mean really good company with good food in a really funky, beautiful house in the middle of a field where someone came and serviced the place for us.
I don't think you can get any more working class than me. Everyone seems posh to me.
When posh boys get into trouble they sack the servants.
There's a difference between being posh and being rich.
It's quite confusing being one of the less wealthy people at a posh place.
We want everybody to have the best facilities in which to work, but we do not believe in posh and impressive private offices.
I've never been aware of the difference between so-called posh actors and working-class actors.
I was obsessed with the Spice Girls! I always wanted to be Sporty. Or Posh, but I wasn't pretty enough.
I'm a terrible sort of non-fussy eater, really. I don't like posh food very much, and the more ingredients something's got in it, the less I tend to like it.
Posh is a way of living that can often be quite miserly and not about money.
I certainly never saw myself as posh.
I'm not posh or common, I'm in between.
I don't think it's the case that 'posh actors' get more work than others.
He just showed up like a posh vampire I accidentally invited in, then couldn't make leave.
Career is just posh slavery.
